question_stem: A rectangle has a perimeter of 14 cm and an area of 10 cmÂ². Let the length of the rectangle be \(x\) cm and the width be \(y\) cm.

parts.question_text: Find the length and width of the rectangle.
parts.solution_text: The perimeter of the rectangle is given by \(2x + 2y = 14\), which simplifies to \(x + y = 7\). The area of the rectangle is given by \(xy = 10\).  From the perimeter equation, we can express \(y\) in terms of \(x\): \(y = 7 - x\). Substituting this into the area equation gives \(x(7 - x) = 10\), which expands to \(7x - x^2 = 10\). Rearranging this gives the quadratic equation \(x^2 - 7x + 10 = 0\). This factorises as \((x - 2)(x - 5) = 0\), so \(x = 2\) or \(x = 5\). If \(x = 2\), then \(y = 7 - 2 = 5\). If \(x = 5\), then \(y = 7 - 5 = 2\). Therefore, the length and width of the rectangle are 5 cm and 2 cm (or vice-versa).
